str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A created thing, a creature. From ktizo; an original formation, i.e. Product.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
And, even, also, namely.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
And, even, also, namely.
Underneath, below, under. From hupo and kato; down under, i.e. Beneath.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.

(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.

Adulation, praise, blessing, gift.
And, even, also, namely.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
And, even, also, namely.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
And, even, also, namely.
Dominion, strength, power; a mighty deed. Perhaps a primary word; vigor.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
